div1.p: Kelly discusses the conflict between Carroll and Guiteras.

div1.head: Letter from Howard A. Kelly to John W. Ross, October 26, 1907
div1.p:
In writing up Carroll's life, he states in a simple
direct way the difficulties he had in getting blood from the
patients at the Las Ensinas Hospital, owing chiefly to Dr.
Guiteras' objection. He states at the end of his letter “Dr
Ross, of course, decided in favor of Guiteras”

I write to ask you if you have any objection to publish-
ing Carroll's letter. It does show that Guitéras did not agree
with Carroll in his course of action, but on your part it was a
mere question of confirmation and official action, and to my
mind is a trifling matter. If you look at it in this way, I
will publish Carroll's letter as read at the Memorial meeting.
I cannot, of course, emend it.
div1.closer: Always very sincerely yours, Ssigned) Howard A. Kelly K
